result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas M Weihert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: -  $170 restitution payable to Thomas Schoechrt, joint but several with Bryan Davidson.

-  DNA sample compliance upon demand. 
-  AODA and follow through with recommended treatment. 
-  Absolute sobriety.
-  No possession or ingestion of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx.  
-  Take any and all RX drugs as prescribed. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  Random drug and alcohol screens.
-  Submit to and cooperate with any other assessment, treatment or counseling per the Agent. 
-  Make good faith efforts to obtain and maintain employment and/or education program per the Agent. 
-  No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise deemed appropriate per the Agent. 
-  No contact with Thomas Schoechert. 
-  No presence at K&S Tool and Die Manufacturing in Ixonia. 

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

records.addlTxt: With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Cases 14CF80 and 14CM156 called at 9:38am.  Clerk - CRHI. (Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Br. 4)
Defendant Nickolas M Weihert in court with attorney Mark S Sweet.  Defendant Nickolas M Weihert in custody.  Monica J Hall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea questionnaire and rights form submitted.  Constitutional rights given.  Maximum penalties and elements recited.
14CF80 - Count #6 - NO CONTEST  plea entered by the Def.   
14CM156 - Count #1 - NO CONTEST plea entered by the Def. 
Factual basis stipulated.  Victim compliance verified.  Court accepts the plea in each case.  Finds the Def. guilty in each case and orders that aJudgment of Conviction be entered in each case.

State moves to read-in and dismiss:
14CF80 - Count #7
14CM56 - Count #2, Count #3 and Count #3

Recommendations presented by Counsel.
Statement presented by the Defendant. 

14CF80:
The Court withholds sentence and places the defendant on probation for 3 years with conditions.  Defendant has no credit for day time served. 
CONDITIONS:
-  Costs - $268
-  $250 DNA surcharge and sample compliance upon demand. 
-  $170 restitution payable to Thomas Schoechrt, joint but several with Bryan Davidson.
-  AODA and follow through with recommended treatment. 
-  Absolute sobriety.
-  No possession or ingestion of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid Rx.  
-  Take any and all RX drugs as prescribed. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  Random drug and alcohol screens.
-  Submit to and cooperate with any other assessment, treatment or counseling per the Agent. 
-  Make good faith efforts to obtain and maintain employment and/or education program per the Agent. 
-  No contact with any known drug offender except for treatment purposes or incidental contact at work/school or otherwise deemed appropriate per the Agent. 
-  No contact with Thomas Schoechert. 
-  No presence at K&S Tool and Die Manufacturing in Ixonia. 

14CM156 - 
-  6 months jail consecutive with Huber to any other sentence in being.  Sentence may be served in Waukesha County conditioned upon electronic monitoring not being used. 
-  Civil judgments for $243 costs and $200 DNA surcharge.
-  $6950.00 civil judgment for restitution payable to K & S Tool and Die.
Status conference on June 13, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 28, 2014 at 09:20 am.

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV: 
cases #14CF80 & #14CM156 called at 8:33am. 
Defendant Nickolas M Weihert in court, in custody, with Attorney Mark S Sweet.  ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

In Case #14CM156 Initial Appearance is conducted: 
--Service of the Complaint admitted, reading waived
--Pleas of "not guilty" are entered
--the Court requires a $500 cash bond, with conditions:
    (1) to maintain absolute sobriety: no posession or consumption of alcohol; no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
    (2) no presence at K & S Tool and Die
    (3) no sales of scrap materials

In Case #14CF80, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing & Arraignment is conducted: 
--Mr. Weihert waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Arraignment.
--Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on Counts #6, #7

recess 8:42am.
